author: iSazonov
body:
Based on discussion https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/3596#discussion_r113464969

Leave only two message for:
1. Count is not in allowed range.
2. Count is not exactly equal allowed value.

/cc @lzybkr @mklement0

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @lzybkr the FullyQualifiedErrorId changed with this PR, does it need to be reviewed by powershell committee as a breaking change?

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: We should document the change, but it's an unlikely breaking change - changing the exception type would be worth discussing, but in this specific case, the error id isn't very interesting.

title: Part 2 - Improve ValidateCount attribute error message
